item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
It is one successful attack. Successes in the attack are the games' way of going "this is a point towards succeeding". Thus why you count the number of successes in your attack on a Kaiju and that determines your damage. The total value of the damage dealt listed when you hit the "Attack!" button is one successful attack.

In other words, where it shows "number of times attacked" and then shows a higher number below that which is the above number plus (2^Tsukiballs thrown)? You take that result and, if it's over 10, subtract 9, then multiply the result by 10, then add 45. So a total of 33 attacks (11 Tsuki) is 33 - 10 = 23 * 10 = 230 + 45 = 275. So if you press the Attack! button 11 times, and throw a Tsukiball all 11 times, you would get 275 tickets in the draw. If the number is under 10, you simply add each number in sequential order.

HOWEVER, there is a function where if you already have the drop, you don't recieve the same number of tickets. I am not sure what the formula is for that, though.
